info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 16 at 1:08PM MDT until April 17 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Fire Weather Watch Sunday Afternoon Due To Low Relative Humidity and Gusty Winds Behind A Southeast to Northwest Wind Shift... .A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for Sunday afternoon for counties along and north of Highway 36 from Yuma County Colorado to Decatur County Kansas. Southeasterly winds during the morning will abruptly shift and increase to the northwest during the mid morning to early afternoon hours on Sunday, creating unpredictable and potentially dangerous fire weather conditions if a fire were to be ongoing. Those not within the watch will still have the potential for unpredictable wildfire spread with the expected wind shift. Any outdoor burning for Sunday is highly discouraged. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001...002...003...079...080...081 AND 252... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma. In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne...Fire Weather Zone 002 Rawlins and Fire Weather Zone 003 Decatur. In Nebraska... Fire Weather Zone 079 Dundy...Fire Weather Zone 080 Hitchcock and Fire Weather Zone 081 Red Willow. * Timing... A Southeast to Northwest wind shift is expected from west to east during the mid morning to early afternoon hours. * Winds...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
